Class BHSingleBlob

java.lang.Object
  BHBlob
      BHSingleBlob

public class BHSingleBlob
extends BHBlob

Manages the blob statistics - points, contours, and binary and gray stats - for a single contiguous group of pixels. If I had to name these again I would have BlobBase, Bloblet and Blob where this is a Bloblet.

This is where the perimeter contours (outer and inner) are stored as well as the convex hull. The convex hull is not computed until requested, and then it is stored so it doesn't have to be recomputed.

Provisions have been made for the storage of the perimeter that follows the crack between pixels, like ImageJ's Wand produces. At this time the crack contours are not computed.

Contact: Mike Sieracki, msieracki@bigelow.org
Author: Ben Tupper, btupper@bigelow.org
History: Developed over the course of 2009 and 2010 using ImageJ 1.43 and Mac OSX 10.5.8
at Bigelow Laboratory for Ocean Science, www.bigelow.org

2010-02-27 BTT now uses Calibration for coordinate conversions 2010-04-07 BTT added "crack" boundary stuff

computeStats

public void computeStats()

computeVolume

public double computeVolume()
Computes the volume estimate based upon the switch volMethod control Currently then CCL style perimeters are required for the SVW_Volume method. the volume must be calculated for each particle added to this blob

computeVol_SKEDM

public double computeVol_SKEDM()
Computes the volume using the product of the skeletonization (SK) and the Euclidean Distance Map (EDM). This is proabaly the slowest of all the methods but timing is untested.

computeVol_ABD

public double computeVol_ABD()
Computes the volume by transforming the area to an area based radius. Use that radius is used in vol = 4/3*pi*r^3

computeVol_SVW

public double computeVol_SVW()
Computes the volume via Sieracki, Viles and Webb (1989).
